commit_message:
Remove useless quotes for nodes

A few projects used excess '' for node declarations, remove them.

We had 17 'ubuntu-trusty' and 285 ubuntu-trusty,
and 25 'ubuntu-xenial' and 744 ubuntu-xenial.

This changes all node names for consistency, thus making search easier.

Change-Id: I0cf565d1e31ea246f3b9d93bbd8de9980df4c684

Clean up driverfixes branch jobs

There have been a few jobs added that need to be skipped
for the driverfixes/* branches. Also cleaning up some
stable/mitaka references as that is now EOL.

commit_message:
neutron: add ovs firewall tempest job to check queue

The job has been in experimental for a while and is currently passing.
It was triggered only 3 times in the last month and always passed. This
patch requests to add the job as non-voting just to get better overview
of its stability. There are currenlty no known issues so we can make it
voting very soon if it's proven stable enough.

Change-Id: I7bf679e53a4c86a41fd12ce78a1361b62bbf36cc

commit_message:
TripleO: experimental container upgrade job on more repos

So far we've only been running the container upgrade job on the
tripleo-ci repository. The job is now implemented and we got successful
runs with it recently, we should run it on repos we run the normal
upgrade job. Experimental and non-voting for now.

Change-Id: I410acaed5a263b529a8c56badea52561096b5ec3

commit_message:
Add external CA certs to cluster template

Adds new --ext-ca-certs-file option for magnum CLI utility. The option
provides content of external CA certificate(s) to be installed on
cluster VMs to allow HTTPS connections to external servers.

Depends-On: Ic9cb2f0f25f7bbfe8e14b1a72fab6d5002518aac
Change-Id: I78305526af03703def29b1f1b77c99fce1631067
Closes-Bug: 1580704

The other tests of volume action already exist.

subject: Add support of a linuxbridge bridge in data-port config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 15:50:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/commit/7cfa9f95dc1198cad9351c2ba16be322a778e99c', 'message': 'Add support of a linuxbridge bridge in data-port config

When configuring data-port parameter with "ovs-bridge:linuxbridge"
a veth pair will be created to connect these two bridges. Name of
these virtual interfaces will be "veth-ovsbridge_name" and
"veth-linuxbridge_name".

Problem: When deploying neutron-openvswitch charm on a node contain
only one interface, we are not able to connect an ovs brdige to
the physical interface because it is assigned to juju Bridge.

commit_message:
Add support of a linuxbridge bridge in data-port config

When configuring data-port parameter with "ovs-bridge:linuxbridge"
a veth pair will be created to connect these two bridges. Name of
these virtual interfaces will be "veth-ovsbridge_name" and
"veth-linuxbridge_name".

Problem: When deploying neutron-openvswitch charm on a node contain
only one interface, we are not able to connect an ovs Bridge to
the physical interface because it is assigned to juju Bridge.

Change-Id: I5be72b9cc5948f5f791d522d1b46fd27e7303613
Closes-Bug:#1635067
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch refs/changes/12/392212/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Port can also be a linuxbridge bridge. In this case a veth pair will be created, the ovs bridge and the linuxbridge bridge will be connected. It can be useful to connect the ovs bridge to juju bridge.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 10:02:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/pecan_wsgi/test_hooks.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c432362a16541fb811e42288fdc8cf3983608478', 'message': "Init policy in pecan after hook as well

policy.init() is called in the before hook, but this isn't
invoked on GET calls so if the first call a thread receives
is a GET call, we can end up with an uninitialized policy
enforcer and get a traceback.

This just calls policy.init() in the after hook as well.

Change-Id: I29ebc9a91b98a27e707d5b35ad1a24a26e8c8f44
Closes-Bug: #1671267
(cherry picked from commit 4c40016dfba21a851d1cac5ce199ddcca001562b)
(cherry picked from commit 816ccb35b436ef793d23749c7017e362ec815838)
"}]
commit_message:
Init policy in pecan after hook as well

policy.init() is called in the before hook, but this isn't
invoked on GET calls so if the first call a thread receives
is a GET call, we can end up with an uninitialized policy
enforcer and get a traceback.

This just calls policy.init() in the after hook as well.

Change-Id: I29ebc9a91b98a27e707d5b35ad1a24a26e8c8f44
Closes-Bug: #1671267
(cherry picked from commit 4c40016dfba21a851d1cac5ce199ddcca001562b)
(cherry picked from commit 816ccb35b436ef793d23749c7017e362ec815838)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/460915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: policy.init()

commit_message:
Replace neutronclient with REST API calls in router commands

All router related commands to Neutron like
list/create/update/delete/add_interface/remove_interface
are now made via keystoneauth

Change-Id: I81592285268030e4868ef6b522bc7937a31c756e

commit_message:
Remove two lines that are leftover and broken

Not really sure how these crept in - they never would have made sense.
Also not sure how this codepath _worked_ in the live test I used (with
the results in IRC) - but they definitely break as they should when
triggered in unit tests.

Change-Id: Iddc69cbd325c7a3a25cde48a2b2bddb01826c0ff

commit_message:
Add package import to openstack CLI

usage: openstack package import [-h] [-f {csv,json,table,value,yaml}]
                                [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>]
                                [--noindent]
                                [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}]
                                [--categories [<CATEGORY> [<CATEGORY>
...]]]
                                [--is-public IS_PUBLIC]
                                [--package-version PACKAGE_VERSION]
                                [--exists-action {a,s,u}]
                                [--dep-exists-action {a,s,u}]
                                [--murano-repo-url MURANO_REPO_URL]
                                <FILE> [<FILE> ...]

Partially implements: blueprint openstack-client-plugin-support
Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iddc3a6d07bfbb04ba601446078d36839adf640c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/28/418428/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: package_import = muranoclient.osc.v1.package:ImportPackage

commit_message:
Use https for docs.openstack.org (4/4)

We switched to https for docs.openstack.org, adjust most URLs.

Note that the validate test failed the puppet modules since
stable/liberty could not be checked out. Thus these files are not
touched. Also, fairy-slipper was not touched since it's retired and not
in zuul/layout.yaml.

Change-Id: I89aa7b3c7da626ac75d493bdf863041053c76684

commit_message:
Remove neutronclient mocks from ports tests

Neutronclient mock is replaced by mocking REST calls using
base.RequestsMockTestCase class

Change-Id: If6cbe3c926ead8e0fbabcf602cf0ea8db9fec922
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/49/461149/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestPort(base.RequestsMockTestCase): def test_create_port(self): self.register_uris([ dict(method="POST", uri=self.get_mock_url( 'network', 'public', append=['v2.0', 'ports.json']), json=self.mock_neutron_port_create_rep, validate=dict( json={'port': { 'network_id': 'test-net-id', 'name': 'test-port-name', 'admin_state_up': True}})) ]) self.assert_calls() def test_create_port_exception(self): self.register_uris([ dict(method="POST", uri=self.get_mock_url( 'network', 'public', append=['v2.0', 'ports.json']), status_code=500, validate=dict( json={'port': { commit_message:
Add optional error_message to adapter.request

When we make REST cals, sometimes we want to provide a more helpful
error string. Add an optional argument to the calls to allow this.

Change-Id: I797e34cda9f27c18d66a42fd5860fe572fa55ada

commit_message:
Fix ValueError when incorrect metadata passed

If you pass incorrect formatted metadata to the 'boot', 'rebuild'
and 'image-create' apis returns following error:

ERROR (ValueError): dictionary update sequence element #0 has
length 1; 2 is required

Caught the ValuError and raised argparse.ArgumentTypeError with
proper error message.

Closes-Bug: #1668549
Change-Id: I14a30b93f4a916fc04610f9e475c12eb352e38c5
(cherry picked from commit 72a0ec9adcd19a96644638e8324566fcc4af8799)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/43/444343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_boot_with_incorrect_metadata(self): cmd = ('boot --image %s --flavor 1 --meta foo ' 'some-server ' % FAKE_UUID_1) result = self.assertRaises(argparse.ArgumentTypeError, self.run_command, cmd) expected = "'['foo']' is not in the format of 'key=value'" self.assertEqual(expected, result.args[0]) def test_create_image_with_incorrect_metadata(self): cmd = 'image-create sample-server mysnapshot --metadata foo' result = self.assertRaises(argparse.ArgumentTypeError, self.run_command, cmd) expected = "'['foo']' is not in the format of 'key=value'" self.assertEqual(expected, result.args[0]) def test_rebuild_with_incorrect_metadata(self): cmd = 'rebuild sample-server %s --name asdf --meta foo' % FAKE_UUID_1 result = self.assertRaises(argparse.ArgumentTypeError, self.run_command, cmd) expected = "'['foo']' is not in the format of 'key=value'" self.assertEqual(expected, result.args[0])

Add new PROXY protocol to lbaas pool

This patch enable configure PROXY protocol informs to backend
server about the lay 3/4 address of the incoming connections.

Close-Bug: #1677987

Signed-off-by: cheng <tangch318@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pass option list instead of group name

The option list registered in config.py should be
used instead of the group name since the group name
is used as the first parameter and the second parameter
should be the option list

Change-Id: I1ef372cce5a92b267e7c7feac7e1b56cd8dfa57f
Closes-Bug: #1629573

commit_message:
Add option to run actions locally on the engine

Make executor pluggable and allow option to run the executor
locally on the engine or remotely over RPC.

Change-Id: I7cfb13068aa1d1f88136eaa092e629c34b78adf2

Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

commit_message:
Fix unauthorized exception in users panel

If a member role user login and use admin to get keystoneclient,
but he is not a super user, then a notAuthorized exceptions will be raised,
it seems to be unreasonable.

The following actions will throw unauthorized exception.

Go to Users panel, Click user name , Click Change Password,
Submit Change Password form.

Change-Id: I4f6486b92f023ad0daecfff51e3a1ed16b0e78c0
Closes-Bug: #1684475

commit_message:
Add direction to known bandwidth_limit_rules parameters

Parameter `direction` is introduced for qos_bandwidth_limit
rule type in neutron in Ia13568879c2b6f80fb190ccafe7e19ca05b0c6a8
By default each rule has got EGRESS direction so this value of
direction is supported by existing qos_driver.

Change-Id: I5e2a3e56fc29234dd1affb4eb4a35f447eaf7ea2
Depends-On: Ia13568879c2b6f80fb190ccafe7e19ca05b0c6a8

DIB bootstraps puppet on nodes with an upstream's project-config.
For 3rd party CI systems it is essential to bootstrap puppet with
a forked version of project-config.
This commit enables to control which project-config repository

Change-Id: I4667a685fea4d60f6fc26b41a14b9234439404a7
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 12:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/puppet/bin/prepare-node'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/1ee7d25c40c93eccb58598c9ef6bbf0764a1cf19', 'message': "enable bootstrap puppet with forked project-config

DIB bootstraps puppet on nodes with an upstream's project-config.
For 3rd party CI systems it is essential to bootstrap puppet with

Change-Id: I4667a685fea4d60f6fc26b41a14b9234439404a7
"}]
commit_message:
enable bootstrap puppet with forked project-config

DIB bootstraps puppet on nodes with an upstream's project-config.
For 3rd party CI systems it is essential to bootstrap puppet with
a forked version of project-config.
This commit enables to control which project-config repository
is used for bootstraping puppet on a node.

Change-Id: I4667a685fea4d60f6fc26b41a14b9234439404a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/86/394186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PROJECT_CONFIG_REPO_URL=${PROJECT_CONFIG_REPO_URL:-"https://git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/project-config"} project_config_repo => $PROJECT_CONFIG_REPO_URL,

commit_message:
Use cg object when invoking update cg method.

Replace group with cg when invoking
'update_consistencygroup' method.

Change-Id: I8c5b89934583975523d9b69edf23e7de53cc9c99

commit_message:
Use journal.record everywhere

There's no need to call the DB layer, this should be abstracted by
journal.record so use that everyewhere instead of directly calling the
function.
This has no impact on tests so no need to change them to use this
function.

Change-Id: I38a54ef7c9b2f52f427a95cff243676dbe8d5a3b
(cherry picked from commit 0c56825fd4137c10308053659679a4d943c88de7)
Closes-Bug: #1674727

commit_message:
Add ssh-keyscan to unblock kolla-ansible gate

As a change to remove puppet from infra nodepool,
ssh-keyscan is needed for each node.[0]

Host key checking was disabled by default by jenkins
user. [1]

Refs:
[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-April/116036.html
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460731/
Change-Id: I0f4000f18b7a2b3266c95c3f7a5109e3603c94a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/82/460782/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ssh-keyscan "${ip}" >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts

commit_message:
Add reserved_host_cpus option

When discussing for the blueprint placement-claims we had a consensus on
using reserved values for helping operators to provide overhead limits
for all the instances.

Since we only had 2 opts for RAM and disk, we missed a possible CPU one.
This patch is adding that one.

Change-Id: Ic3162f0ab39a703798b4a2a7e860fed628da1e7e
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

commit_message:
Update sitemap tests

- add py3 to tox.ini (gate already tests py3)
- move all tests to $GITROOT/test so they can all run
  through testr
- add scrapy to test-requirements.txt to support sitemap tests
- move tests from test_items.py to test_sitemap_file.py
- fix broken sitemap tests
- add newton to list of old releases in sitemap_file.py
- ignore flake8 H101 as it returns false positives for Sphinx conf.py
- Use openstackdocstheme for docs
- Update sitemap README
- Restructure repo docs
- fix minor style issues

Change-Id: I22c018149b2eefde6ca5c38c22ac06886fe9a7a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/76/453976/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:sitemap] deps = -r{toxinidir}/sitemap/test-requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/sitemap/requirements.txt commands = flake8 sitemap pytest sitemap ignore = H101 [pytest] norecursedirs = .git .tox doc python_files= *.py addopts = -v --ignore=setup.py --doctest-modules --tb short --cov=sitemap/ --cov-report term-missing --cov-config tox.ini [report] # pytest-cov configuration omit = *test_*.py exclude_lines = # Regexes for lines to exclude from consideration pragma: no cover # Have to re-enable the standard pragma if __name__ == .__main__.: # Don't include __main__ statements in coverage report

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Pre-zoned port group fix

If there are more than one masking view on the same compute node
with different portgroups, then code did not always pick the
correct masking view to extract the port group from. This can
happen when a system is pre-zoned FC.

Change-Id: I6787f9415d97ce5988984f3aeac05c02c5217aac
Closes-Bug: #1682176

commit_message:
Set a cap on fog-core

fog-core 1.44.0 pulls in xmlrpc which requires ruby 2.3.0. Set a cap
since we don't have ruby 2.3.0 and we don't even use the fog-core stuff
anyway. Thanks beaker.

Change-Id: Ib080ea00f45a91a904a8e1e2956ad5295b7cf4d8
(cherry picked from commit 76e7573b4ea355dd89d0ab389d375a790075b41b)

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I4ea47989c4d47c733dc7d547210faf9c494a74f3
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Octavia+Neutron-LBaaS client needs added to PROJECTS still

Looking at the result of the gate jobs now, and this example from
glance, we still need to add it to PROJECTS manually:
https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/glance.yaml#L18-L19

Change-Id: I14c0ed171ff779594816a607d9eea1a8c02df92e

commit_message:
Removing the confusing SWARM_MODE variable

The SWARM_MODE variable is for determining whether to set the
cluster_store options of docker daemon. Therefore, change it to
DOCKER_CLUSTER_STORE to make it clear.

Change-Id: I79f00c7cc158d825627ce6a9d28b053b0cf3c076
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-container refs/changes/27/461227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # - ``ETCD_PORT`` must be defined if on swarm modeSWARM_MODE=$(trueorfalse False SWARM_MODE) if [[ "$SWARM_MODE" = "True" ]]; then cluster_store_opts+="\"cluster-store\": \"etcd://localhost:$ETCD_PORT\","

commit_message:
Add Initial Prometheus support.

This PS starts adding Prometheus support. It adds
monitoring of the python api based services.

Partially-Implements: blueprint prometheus

Change-Id: I6f431087565b8574add10d5cc6bee299b7df471c

subject: Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 14:47:45.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/queue/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/fac2c28ba0f0757d84523eda9643563d313af098', 'message': "Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods
since 5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

FutureWarning: The access_policy argument is changing its default
value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'>
in version '?', please update the code to explicitly set None as the
value: access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes
private methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy
or ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: I194187ec697ac0e0ecbc9fa98a1f8c0a6229a8ee
"}]
commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods
since 5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

FutureWarning: The access_policy argument is changing its default
value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'>
in version '?', please update the code to explicitly set None as the
value: access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes
private methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy
or ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: I194187ec697ac0e0ecbc9fa98a1f8c0a6229a8ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/68/461068/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_messaging.rpc import dispatcher access_policy = dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy serializer=serializer, access_policy=access_policy)

commit_message:
Sub pycrypto with cryptography test_cert_resources

pycrypto is no longer maintained [1]. This patch rewrites functions
using pycrypto and replaces them with the cryptography equivalent for
the test_cert_resources.py file

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568

Change-Id: I345c411abd2cf405cfc0a9163b4b60daca8d66c5

commit_message:
Remove unused references from config-generator

When operating `tox -e genconfig`, the tox did output the following
warning message:

  WARNING:stevedore.named:Could not load oslo.rootwrap,
  oslo.serialization, oslo.utils, oslo.vmware, oslo.context, oslo.i18n

because these oslo modules don't have any config options.
This patch removes this invalid references from config-generator.

Change-Id: Ied7c6b8a538336cd5008c90dd12d8e882b53a64d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/65/454865/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: namespace = oslo.contextnamespace = oslo.i18nnamespace = oslo.rootwrap namespace = oslo.serializationnamespace = oslo.utilsnamespace = oslo.vmware

commit_message:
Set a cap on fog-core

fog-core 1.44.0 pulls in xmlrpc which requires ruby 2.3.0. Set a cap
since we don't have ruby 2.3.0 and we don't even use the fog-core stuff
anyway. Thanks beaker.

Change-Id: Ib080ea00f45a91a904a8e1e2956ad5295b7cf4d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/29/461229/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # fog-core 1.44.0 requires xmlrpc 0.3.0 which requires ruby 2.3.0 which is not available on centos7 spec.add_dependency 'fog-core', ['< 1.44.0']

commit_message:
use requests.session to avoid http open/close

Avoid open/close http connection to ODL everytime to send request to ODL.
use reqeusts.session instead of requests.request.

Change-Id: Ibb7e0607beb5f3541c063ef9e78d75dff37282a7
Closes-bug: #1669609
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/66/440866/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls = self.__class__ if not hasattr(cls, 'session'): cls.session = requests.session(auth=(username, password), timeout=timeout) return self.__class__.session.request( method, url=url, headers=headers, data=data)
deleted_lines: self.timeout = timeout self.auth = (username, password) return requests.request( method, url=url, headers=headers, data=data, auth=self.auth, timeout=self.timeout)

pairs with the pymemcached package.

commit_message:
ds8k: check lun exist or not when clone volume

when user enable image volume cache and failed cloning volume after
creating target volume at the first time, target volume will be
deleted in the storage, but the volume ID in target volume object
is not cleanup, so when it is sent to driver again, it will not exist.

Change-Id: I0d949d3d1837db3a0af19a4eecd97ed761abe1ef
Closes-Bug: #1680343

commit_message:
[upstream] Generalize Jenkins slides to Zuul

During review of the upstream training slides is was decided
that the existing detailed overview of Jenkins was not as
helpful.  We decided to generalize the topic a bit to talk
about Zuul and the different types of gates.

This patch removes the old content and renames the slides
accordingly.  The content now introduces status.openstack.org ,
explains Zuul and the different pipelines.  Talks about how to
find logs and investigate elastic-recheck failures.  As with
other updates things have are more exercise focused.

Change-Id: If527a57ee3874aa0168d08f093937970f90b1d10

commit_message:
Set OS_AUTH_TYPE to password

Devstack configures keystone for auth mechanism but don't tell
keystoneauth1 library that it should use keystone too.

In simple case, this is not an issue because some application
set 'password' by default (like the openstack cli).

But applications can have no default or another default.

Change-Id: Idd1e1d2e7546fce7531175440788a8c7cb27aec1

Add gate_hook and post_test_hook

We are setting up a devstack job for this plugin. These hooks will
be leveraged by the job.

Adds generate pot script

This commit adds a tox job to generate a pot file
from I18n Contributor Guide.

commit_message:
[upstream] Update the Metrics slides

Update community numbers and add a slide for generic guidance
on metrics.

Remove analytics.o.o slides as that page is not maintained and widely
used currently.

# Eugen Block <eblock@nde.ag>, 2017. #zanata"POT-Creation-Date: 2017-04-19 17:46+0000
""PO-Revision-Date: 2017-04-28 01:25+0000
" "Last-Translator: Eugen Block <eblock@nde.ag>
"#, fuzzy msgid "Add the compute node to the cell database" msgstr "Fügen Sie den Compute-Knoten zur Cell-Datenbank hinzu." "the `SLES 12 <https://www.suse.com/documentation/sles-12/book_sle_admin/data/" "sec_basicnet_manconf.html>`__ or `openSUSE <https://doc.opensuse.org/" "documentation/leap/reference/html/book.opensuse.reference/cha.basicnet." "html>`__ documentation." msgstr "" "Nachdem das Betriebssystem auf jedem Knoten mit der gewünschten Architektur " "installiert wurde, müssen die Netzwerkschnittstellen konfiguriert werden. Es " "wird empfohlen, alle Dienste zur automatisierten Netzwerkverwaltung zu " "deaktivieren und die entsprechenden Konfigurationsdateien für Ihre " "Distribution manuell anzupassen. Für weitere Informationen zum Konfigurieren " "der Netzwerke in Ihrer Distribution lesen Sie die Dokumentation für `SLES " "12 <https://www.suse.com/documentation/sles-12/book_sle_admin/data/" "sec_basicnet_manconf.html>`__ oder für `openSUSE <https://doc.opensuse.org/" "documentation/leap/reference/html/book.opensuse.reference/cha.basicnet." "html>`__." msgid "" "After installing the operating system on each node for the architecture that " "you choose to deploy, you must configure the network interfaces. We " "recommend that you disable any automated network management tools and " "manually edit the appropriate configuration files for your distribution. For " "more information on how to configure networking on your distribution, see "msgid "Change the existing line ``OPTIONS="-l 127.0.0.1,::1"``." msgstr "Ändern Sie die bestehende Zeile in ``OPTIONS="-l 127.0.0.1,::1"``." "Configure ``Default`` as the default domain for users that you create via " "the dashboard:" msgstr "" "Konfigurieren Sie ``Default`` als Standarddomäne für Benutzer, die über das " "Dashboard angelegt werden:" msgid ""msgid "" "Configure the service to use the management IP address of the controller " "node. This is to enable access by other nodes via the management network:" msgstr "" "Konfigurieren Sie den Dienst so, dass die Management-IP-Adresse des " "Controller-Knoten verwendet wird. Dadurch wird der Zugriff durch andere " "Knoten über das Management-Netzwerk ermöglicht." msgid "Create the ``cell1`` cell:" msgstr "Erzeugen Sie die Zelle ``cell1``:" msgid "Create the ``nova_api``, ``nova``, and ``nova_cell0`` databases:" msgstr "" "Erstellen Sie die Datenbanken ``nova_api``, ``nova``, und ``nova_cell0``:" "Edit the ``/etc/sysconfig/memcached`` file and complete the following " "actions:" msgstr "" "Bearbeiten Sie die Datei ``/etc/sysconfig/memcached`` und führen folgende " "Schritte durch:" msgid """For more information on registering the system, see the `Red Hat Enterprise " "Linux 7 System Administrator's Guide <https://access.redhat.com/" "documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/7/html/" "System_Administrators_Guide/part-Subscription_and_Support.html>`_." msgstr "" "Für weitere Informationen zur Registrierung des Systems lesen Sie den `Red " "Hat Enterprise Linux 7 System Administrator's Guide <https://access.redhat." "com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/7/html/" "System_Administrators_Guide/part-Subscription_and_Support.html> _." msgid """In addition to ``rhel-7-server-rpms``, you also need to have the ``rhel-7-" "server-optional-rpms``, ``rhel-7-server-extras-rpms``, and ``rhel-7-server-" "rh-common-rpms`` repositories enabled:" msgstr "" "Zusätzlich zu den ``rhel-7-server-rpms`` benötigen Sie außerdem die " "Repositories ``rhel-7-server-optional-rpms``, ``rhel-7-server-extras-rpms``, " "und ``rhel-7-server-rh-common-rpms``." msgid """Installation and configuration is documented in the `Bare Metal installation " "guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/baremetal/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Bare Metal " "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "baremetal/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Container " "Infrastructure Management installation guide <https://docs.openstack.org/" "project-install-guide/container-infrastructure-management/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Container " "Infrastructure Management Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/" "project-install-guide/container-infrastructure-management/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `DNS installation guide " "<https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/dns/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `DNS-" "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/dns/" "ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Database installation " "guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/database/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Datenbank-" "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "database/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Key Manager " "installation guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/key-" "manager/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration ind dokumentiert in der `Key Manager " "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/key-" "manager/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Messaging installation " "guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/messaging/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Messaging " "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "messaging/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Object Storage " "installation guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/object-" "storage/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Object Storage " "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "object-storage/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Orchestration " "installation guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "orchestration/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Orchestrierungs-" "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "orchestration/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Shared File Systems " "installation guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/shared-" "file-systems/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Shared File Systems " "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "shared-file-systems/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Telemetry Alarming " "installation guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "telemetry-alarming/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Telemetrie Alarming " "Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "telemetry-alarming/ocata>`_." msgid "" "Installation and configuration is documented in the `Telemetry Data " "Collection installation guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-" "guide/telemetry/ocata>`_." msgstr "" "Installation und Konfiguration sind dokumentiert in der `Telemetrie Data " "Collection Installationsanleitung <https://docs.openstack.org/project-" "install-guide/telemetry/ocata>`_." msgid """Most OpenStack services use an SQL database to store information. The " "database typically runs on the controller node. The procedures in this guide " "use MariaDB or MySQL depending on the distribution. OpenStack services also " "support other SQL databases including `PostgreSQL <https://www.postgresql." "org/>`__." msgstr "" "Die meisten OpenStack-Dienste nutzen eine SQL-Datenbank zum Speichern von " "Informationen. Die Datenbank läuft normalerweise auf dem Controller-Knoten. " "Abhängig von der Distribution wird in diesem Leitfaden MariaDB oder MySQL " "verwendet. OpenStack-Dienste unterstützen außerdem weitere SQL-Datenbanken, " "unter anderen auch `PostgreSQL <https://www.postgresql.org/>`__." msgid """OpenStack uses a :term:`message queue` to coordinate operations and status " "information among services. The message queue service typically runs on the " "controller node. OpenStack supports several message queue services including " "`RabbitMQ <https://www.rabbitmq.com>`__, `Qpid <https://qpid.apache.org>`__, " "and `ZeroMQ <http://zeromq.org>`__. However, most distributions that package " "OpenStack support a particular message queue service. This guide implements " "the RabbitMQ message queue service because most distributions support it. If " "you prefer to implement a different message queue service, consult the " "documentation associated with it." msgstr "" "OpenStack verwendet eine :term:`message queue` zur Koordination von " "Operationen und Statusinformationen innerhalb der Dienste. Der " "Nachrichtenwarteschlangen-Dienst läuft üblicherweise auf dem Controller-" "Knoten. OpenStack unterstützt verschiedene Nachrichtendienste, u.a. " "`RabbitMQ <https://www.rabbitmq.com>`__, `Qpid <http://qpid.apache.org>`__, " "und `ZeroMQ <http://zeromq.org>`__. Allerdings unterstützen die meisten " "Distributionen, die OpenStack anbieten, einen bestimmten Nachrichtendienst. " "Dieser Leitfaden implementiert den RabbitMQ Nachrichtendienst, weil dieser " "von den meisten Distributionen unterstützt wird. Wenn Sie einen anderen " "Dienst bevorzugen, beachten Sie die entsprechende Dokumentation dazu." msgid """Optionally, install and configure the backup service. For simplicity, this " "configuration uses the Block Storage node and the Object Storage (swift) " "driver, thus depending on the `Object Storage service <https://docs." "openstack.org/project-install-guide/object-storage/ocata/>`_." msgstr "" "Optional kann der Backup-Dienst installiert und konfiguriert werden. Zur " "Vereinfachung wird in dieser Konfiguration der Blockspeicher-Knoten und der " "Objektspeicher-Treiber (Swift) verwendet. Somit gibt es eine Abhängigkeit " "zum `Objektspeicher-Dienst <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/" "object-storage/ocata/>`_ ." msgid ""msgid "Populate the nova database:" msgstr "Befüllen Sie die Nova-Datenbank:" msgid "Populate the nova-api database:" msgstr "Befüllen Sie die Nova-API-Datenbank:" msgid "Register the ``cell0`` database:" msgstr "Registrieren Sie die Datenbank ``cell0``:" msgid "Run the following commands on the **controller** node." msgstr "Führen Sie folgende Befehle auf dem Controller-Knoten aus." msgid "Search" msgstr "Suche" "The Newton release is available directly through the official Debian " "backports repository. To use this repository, follow the instruction from " "the official `Debian website <https://backports.debian.org/Instructions/>`_, " "which basically suggest doing the following steps:" msgstr "" "Das Newton-Release ist direkt über das offizielle Debian Backport Repository " "verfügbar. Um dieses Repository zu verwenden, folgen Sie den Anweisungen der " "offiziellen `Debian Website <https://backports.debian.org/Instructions/>`_, " "die im Grunde die folgenden Schritte empfiehlt:" msgid """The ``--external`` option defines the virtual network to be external. If you " "wish to create an internal network, you can use ``--internal`` instead. " "Default value is ``internal``." msgstr "" "Die Option ``--external`` definiert das virtuelle Netzwerk als externes " "Netzwerk. Wenn Sie ein internes Netzwerk erzeugen möchten, verwenden Sie " "stattdessen die Option ``--internal``. Der Standardwert ist ``internal``." msgid """The following steps apply to RHEL only. CentOS does not require these steps." msgstr "" "Die folgenden Schritte sind nur für RHEL anwendbar, für CentOS werden diese " "Schritte nicht benötigt." msgid """The provider network must include the ``router:external`` option to enable " "self-service routers to use it for connectivity to external networks such as " "the Internet. The ``admin`` or other privileged user must include this " "option during network creation or add it later. In this case, the ``router:" "external`` option was set by using the ``--external`` parameter when " "creating the ``provider`` network." msgstr "" "Das Anbieternetzwerk muss die Option ``router:external`` enthalten, damit " "self-service-Router eine Verbindung zu externen Netzwerken wie z. B. dem " "Internet herstellen können. Der ``admin`` oder ein anderer privilegierter " "Benutzer muss diese Option entweder während der Netzwerkerstellung setzen " "oder zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt hinzufügen. In diesem Fall wurde die " "Option ``router:external`` durch den Parameter ``--external`` während des " "Erstellens des ``provider``-Netzwerkes gesetzt." msgid """To ease the installation process, this guide only covers password security " "where applicable. You can create secure passwords manually, generate them " "using a tool such as `pwgen <https://sourceforge.net/projects/pwgen/>`_, or " "by running the following command:" msgstr "" "Um den Installationsprozess zu vereinfachen, werden in diesem Leitfaden nur " "Passwörter als Sicherheitsmaßnahme verwendet. Sichere Passwörter können " "entweder manuell erstellt werden, mit Hilfe von Werkzeugen wie `pwgen " "<https://sourceforge.net/projects/pwgen/>`_ generiert werden oder mit " "folgendem Befehl erzeugt werden:" msgid ""msgid "Verify nova cell0 and cell1 are registered correctly:" msgstr "Überprüfen Sie, ob cell0 und cell1 richtig registriert sind:" msgid "" "When using RHEL, it is assumed that you have registered your system using " "Red Hat Subscription Management and that you have the ``rhel-7-server-rpms`` " "repository enabled by default." msgstr "" "Wenn Sie RHEL verwenden, wird angenommen, dass Sie Ihr System mit Hilfe von " "Red Hat Subscription Management registriert haben und das Repository " "``rhel-7-server-rpms`` standardmäßig aktiviert ist." msgid "``METADATA_SECRET``" msgstr "``METADATA_SECRET``" msgid "``PLACEMENT_PASS``" msgstr "``PLACEMENT_PASS``"

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-29 00:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['grafana/mosquitto.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/217a956a1953500f6ade3b68fac19c4502a2c184', 'message': "Add messages dropped to mosquitto graphs and add units

This commit cleans up the grafana dashboard for mosquitto a bit by
adding units to the titles so we know what the data we're looking at is.
Additionally it adds a new line for messages dropped which is another

Change-Id: I4940c0fbf48ddd41c745d643bc95652bb5eaa9d4
"}]
commit_message:
Add messages dropped to mosquitto graphs and add units

This commit cleans up the grafana dashboard for mosquitto a bit by
adding units to the titles so we know what the data we're looking at is.
Additionally it adds a new line for messages dropped which is another
stat we're populating from mqtt_statsd.

Change-Id: I4940c0fbf48ddd41c745d643bc95652bb5eaa9d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/85/461185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - title: Message Rates (messages / minute) - target: alias(stats.gauges.mosquitto.messages_dropped, 'Messages Dropped') - title: Heap Size (Bytes) - title: Data Transfered (bytes / minute)
deleted_lines: - title: Message Statistics - title: Heap Size - title: Data Transfers

tests: more live verification

Sometime live tests fail for an yet unknown reason.

This change adds tests to help the debugging of this failure.

commit_message:
fix search by user_id/project_id

Since we store user_id/project_id as creator, we bokre the per
user/project metric listing.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I92555d0020658ddecf37e4a8be9cfa27452a7a14

commit_message:
quota-update to return an error msg for 0 args

If no arguments are provided while executing neutron quota-update
instead of printing the current quota values it will throw an error
message "Must specify new values to update quota"

Added unit test to verify that the exception is raised when no
arguments are provided to quota update

Includes release notes.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1597552

Change-Id: I476991c39eafa16148f0cc3252ae5c26b9c8cbfc
(cherry picked from commit 98110501e024547dfdc3c3c441ced3f91fe8462c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/89/458589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not quota: raise exceptions.CommandError( message=_('Must specify a valid resource with new quota ' 'value'))

subject: Add sha384 and sha512 auth algorithms for vendor drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-26 12:53:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/db/vpn/test_vpn_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/service_drivers/cisco_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/service_drivers/ipsec_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_validator.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_models.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/38893903cbde_add_auth_algorithm_sha384_and_sha512.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/extensions/vpnaas.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/service_drivers/test_cisco_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/3642efd3605d6ef98ec3b89c19adcf4cb5ea1f0c', 'message': 'Add sha384 and sha512 auth algorithms for vendor drivers

Currently, VPNaaS limits the IPSec and IKE auth algorithm to
"sha1" and "sha256". If user add a new driver(eg, Hardware VPN Gateway),
and the new driver supports more auth algorithms, such as "sha2-384",
"sha2-512", it can not integrated with current VPNaaS plugin.

This patch add "sha384" and "sha512" auth algorithms in API and DB side,
Because of Openswan, Strongswan, Libreswan and Cisco CSR driver doesn't
support these, so we add a validator in ipsec and Cisco CSR service driver,
that will raise an exception when creating or updating the IPSec/IKE Policy
auth algorithm with "sha384" and "sha512".
Other vendors can bypass validate ike_policy and ipsec_policy
when creating and updating auth_algorithm, or implement specific
logic for themselves.

DocImpact
APIImpact
NOTE: CLI support also needs change.

Closes-Bug: #1638152
Change-Id: I87b257ee6500c424fc273955a6d89d972a2823e9
(cherry picked from commit b1530c73da9b8c689c61b3fc726a1ba6e5038ec3)
'}]
commit_message:
Add sha384 and sha512 auth algorithms for vendor drivers

Currently, VPNaaS limits the IPSec and IKE auth algorithm to
"sha1" and "sha256". If user add a new driver(eg, Hardware VPN Gateway),
and the new driver supports more auth algorithms, such as "sha2-384",
"sha2-512", it can not integrated with current VPNaaS plugin.

This patch add "sha384" and "sha512" auth algorithms in API and DB side,
Because of Openswan, Strongswan, Libreswan and Cisco CSR driver doesn't
support these, so we add a validator in ipsec and Cisco CSR service driver,
that will raise an exception when creating or updating the IPSec/IKE Policy
auth algorithm with "sha384" and "sha512".
Other vendors can bypass validate ike_policy and ipsec_policy
when creating and updating auth_algorithm, or implement specific
logic for themselves.

DocImpact
APIImpact
NOTE: CLI support also needs change.

Closes-Bug: #1638152
Change-Id: I87b257ee6500c424fc273955a6d89d972a2823e9
(cherry picked from commit b1530c73da9b8c689c61b3fc726a1ba6e5038ec3)

commit_message:
Small refactoring in tests development docs

- Merged the "Writing Tests" and "Tests Structure" sections:
  both had complementary information.

- Moved "Further Testing" to the end - the intention is to remove this
  section and put details about keystone's tempest and devstack plugins

Change-Id: Ia27b094939a3c76e68ac8e87ef34b7ee611c1929
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/40/457640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tests Structure ---------------backends through the APIs. To add tests covering all drivers, update the base test class in ``test_backend.py``. .. NOTE:: The structure of backend testing is in transition, migrating from having all classes in a single file (test_backend.py) to one where there is a directory structure to reduce the size of the test files. See: - :mod:`keystone.tests.unit.backend.role` - :mod:`keystone.tests.unit.backend.domain_config` To add new drivers, subclass the base class at ``test_backend.py`` (look towards ``test_backend_sql.py`` for examples) and update the configuration of the test class in ``setUp()``.Further Testing --------------- devstack_ is the *best* way to quickly deploy Keystone with the rest of the OpenStack universe and should be critical step in your development workflow! You may also be interested in either the `OpenStack Continuous Integration Infrastructure`_ or the `OpenStack Integration Testing Project`_. .. _devstack: https://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/ .. _OpenStack Continuous Integration Infrastructure: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config .. _OpenStack Integration Testing Project: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest

commit_message:
Correct SUPPORTED_RULES of QoS driver

Type of supported_rules should be dict type instead of list, there
will be an exception[1] when associating qos policy to port. This patch
corrects SUPPORTED_RULES. This param type description in DriverBase()
is incorrect and misleading, I submitted a patch in neutron to correct
it as well.
get_description is remnants of old QoS driver, get rid of it.

[1]Callback neutron.services.qos.qos_plugin.QoSPlugin.
_validate_update_port_callback--9223372036847773271 failed with
"'list' object has no attribute 'get'"

Change-Id: I74a3041cd38fdf8d0e17f35fce223393e198b563

commit_message:
Tests: Remove the redundant methods

This patch removes the redundant tearDown() methods in
order to keep the code clean, In the subclass, tearDown
methods has no benefit from that, the one in superclass
will satisfy that

Change-Id: Id38d2c9de2cde14f897d0e705ec6c086f691bbaf

subject: Fixes retrieving row_by_record for ports on Windows
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-21 10:05:12.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/idlutils.py', 'ovsdbapp/tests/unit/backend/ovs_idl/test_idlutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/4a1f7c1238d174302c46deb70f1b9256186c3ab0', 'message': "Fixes retrieving row_by_record for ports on Windows

On Windows the name of the ports are UUIDs (for Windows
there is no 16 chars length limitation as for Linux).

Since the string is a UUID, it will not fail when it will
try to convert it with 'uuid.UUID(record)'. After this it
will try to fetch the row directly which will raise a
KeyError exception on Windows.

This does not happen on Linux because the port names
have a 16 chars length limitation. The limitation does not
apply in the Windows case. On Linux it will fail at the line
with 'uuid.UUID(record)' which will raise a ValueError
exception and will continue to lookup by other means.

This patch addresses this issue by removing the exception
RowNotFound in the Windows case.

Change-Id: Ia482a6819fbde7366b428fbcb9a05228bb637cc5
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes retrieving row_by_record for ports on Windows

On Windows the name of the ports are UUIDs (for Windows
there is no 16 chars length limitation as for Linux).

Since the string is a UUID, it will not fail when it will
try to convert it with 'uuid.UUID(record)'. After this it
will try to fetch the row directly which will raise a
KeyError exception on Windows.

This does not happen on Linux because the port names
have a 16 chars length limitation. The limitation does not
apply in the Windows case. On Linux it will fail at the line
with 'uuid.UUID(record)' which will raise a ValueError
exception and will continue to lookup by other means.

This patch addresses this issue by removing the exception
RowNotFound in the Windows case.

Change-Id: Ia482a6819fbde7366b428fbcb9a05228bb637cc5

commit_message:
Fix for Group API update to include check policy

All cinder APIs should do policy checks to enforce
role based access controls. All group apis except
groups update has this in place. This changeset
adds policy check for the update groups api.

Adds policy check for create_group_snapshot
Adds policy check for reset_status
Updates unit testcases

Change-Id: I36d3c929709b82cf5f34f681a2e1c34bba9feef9
Closes-Bug: 1676278

Add BGP db model and service

This patch adds BGP db model and BGP service. Currently, BGP service
will sync local cache periodically.

DF bgp service status report will be in following patch, based on
service status report implementation.

commit_message:
Update Devstack plugin for uwsgi and mod_proxy_uwsgi

[0] switched keystone to use uwsgi and mod_proxy_uwsgi by default
instead of mod_wsgi breaking the Devstack plugin which assumed
the latter. This commit fixes the Devstack plugin to work with
both and therefore fixes the functional v3 only gates which
are currently broken.

[0]. I46294fb24e3c23fa19fcfd7d6c9ee8a932354702

Change-Id: Iaffb3f18fd0f1444a6b6067d63474c27eb1bd13d

commit_message:
Make handoffs_first per partition in reconstructor

Modify the object reconstructor to make handoffs_first prioritizes the handoffs
partitions, not only he handoffs fragments. This will make the parameter
consistent with the replicator's one, and give the possibility to operators to
acelerate the rebalances of EC rings.

Change-Id: I318cdfbafa83b745b048be7cc8eeee15fe46e78f

commit_message:
Nova net functional tests round 3

* network segment
* network service
* port
* router
* security group
* security group rule
* subnet
* subnet pool
* extension
  The extension tests were duplicated to have both compute and network
  extensions tests so the nova-net case will still exercise the extension
  commands.

Also clean up formatting from previous reviews to make the Network functional
tests look and act consistently.

Change-Id: I286c40572faa31ddcef595cec740da933b2defc1

commit_message:
Fix volume qos spec list

This has been sporadically failing in functional tests due to the way
the volume qos spec list command calls get_associations() for each spec.
When tests run in parallel occasionally a spec from another test is present
in the list returned and is deleted before the get_associations() call is
made, causing a NotFound exception.  We should just keep going when this
occurs.

* make v1 match v2
* add tests to ensure the exception is being caught and handled

Closes-Bug: #1687083
Change-Id: If2d17c1deb53d293fc2c7f0c527a4e4ef6f69976

commit_message:
Add IPAllocations to the port fixed_ips

Since the IPAM is currently inserting the IPAllocation objects directly
into the DB, the make_port_dict method triggers queries to the DB when
the fixed_ips relationship is accessed, which negatively affects the
performance of Neutron.

This patchset changes this behavior, by appending IPAllocations to the
port's fixed_ips relationship. This change will facilitate the
implementation of enginefacade

Change-Id: Ib32509d974c8654131112234bcf19d6eae8f7cca
Closes-Bug: #1676235
(cherry picked from commit 7f513e547cb0fd0d5c23924d264fd53cdc6141ce)

deleted_lines: context.session.add(allocated) # NOTE(kevinbenton): We add this to the session info so the sqlalchemy # object isn't immediately garbage collected. Otherwise when the # fixed_ips relationship is referenced a new persistent object will be # added to the session that will interfere with retry operations. # See bug 1556178 for details. context.session.info.setdefault('allocated_ips', []).append(allocated)

subject: Set Transfer-Encoding header if we send a chunked body
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-25 16:11:28.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/common/http.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/358e22268b8b53d0c141b5161de692e0d37a4780', 'message': 'Set Transfer-Encoding header if we send a chunked body

This commit fixes the image upload case when we are using a chunked
encoding. Right now if a chunked body is sent we are failing to set the
chunked Transfer-Encoding. This causes real webservers to fail on the
request because they expect an object with a fixed size to be uploaded
and require a content-length. To avoid this we just need to set the
Transfer-Encoding header to tell the webserver that it is a chunked
body.

Change-Id: I71b425547fb200ae03e74fb398cffbb41cf00787
'}]
commit_message:
Set Transfer-Encoding header if we send a chunked body

This commit fixes the image upload case when we are using a chunked
encoding. Right now if a chunked body is sent we are failing to set the
chunked Transfer-Encoding. This causes real webservers to fail on the
request because they expect an object with a fixed size to be uploaded
and require a content-length. To avoid this we just need to set the
Transfer-Encoding header to tell the webserver that it is a chunked
body.

Change-Id: I71b425547fb200ae03e74fb398cffbb41cf00787
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/77/459777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: headers['Transfer-Encoding'] = 'chunked'

Clean up to deployment guide based on walk-through

Multiple cleanups, consistency changes, and a few bugs
corrected.

Also added new section on what to do with OpenStack once is it deployed.
This is WIP and can be added to over-time.

Change-Id: If072de7342d60420913f235677938049a43e7766
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/25/461125/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Kubernetes. This is referred to as the `watch terminal` in this documentation:: watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces .. note:: Alternatively run this which will provide more information including pod ip addresses, but needs a wider terminal as a result: watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o wide IP address ranges, they may be changed. Simply substitute anywhere these addressesInstall Kubernetes 1.6.1 or later and other dependencies::Write the kubernetes repository file::Install Kubernetes 1.6.1 or later and other dependencies::Reload the hand-modified service files::Stop kubelet if it is running::Enable and start docker and kubelet::.. note:: If the following issue occurs after running this command: `preflight] Some fatal errors occurred: /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables contents are not set to 1` There are two work-arounds: - Add `net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables = 1` and `net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables = 1` to ``/etc/sysctl.conf`` - Type `sysctl -p` to apply the settings from /etc/sysctl.conf - Type `sysctl net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip[6]tables` to verify the values are set to 1. - Or alternatively Run with `--skip-preflight-checks`. This runs the risk of missing other issues that may be flagged. Until this step is done, the `watch terminal` will not return information.Finally untaint the node (mark the master node as schedulable) so that PODs can be scheduled to this AIO deployment:: properly. In your `watch terminal`, confirm that Kubernetes has completed initialization by observing that the dns pod is in `3/3 Running` state. If you fail to wait, Step 2 will fail. .. note:: In your `watch terminal` wait for the tiller pod to successfully come up. sudo yum install -y epel-release ansible python-pip python-develModify Kolla ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml`` configuration file:: 1. Set `network_interface` in `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` to the Management interface name. E.g: `eth0`. 2. Set `neutron_external_interface` in `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` to the Neutron interface name. E.g: `eth1`. This is the external interface that Neutron will use. It must not have an IP address assigned to it. Add required configuration to the end of ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml``::Create a local cloud.yml file for the deployment of the charts:: cat <<EOF > cloud.yml EOF .. warning:: This file is populated with several values that will need to be customized to your environment, this is explained below. setting the `variable global.kolla.nova.all.placement_api_enabled` to `false` The next operations are not a simple copy and paste as the rest of this document is structured. In `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` you assigned your Management interface name to `network_interface` (E.g. `eth0`) - we will refer to this as: `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`. Record the ip address assigned to `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML` (E.g. `10.240.43.81`). We will refer to this as: `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_ADDRESS_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`. Also record the name of the `neutron_external_interface` from `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` (E.g. `eth1`). We will refer to this as: `YOUR_NEUTRON_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`. Replace all occurrences of `192.168.7.105` with `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_ADDRESS_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`:: sed -i "s@192.168.7.105@YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_ADDRESS_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml This operation will have changed the values set in: `external_vip`, `dns_name` and `cinder-volumes` variables. Replace `enp1s0f1` with `YOUR_NEUTRON_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`:: sed -i "s@enp1s0f1@YOUR_NEUTRON_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml .. note:: This operation will have changed the value set in: `ext_interface_name` variable. Replace `docker0` with the management interface name (E.g. `eth0`) used for connectivity between nodes in kubernetes cluster, in most cases it is `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`:: sed -i "s@docker0@YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml .. note:: This operation will have changed the value set in: `tunnel_interface` variable.with the devices ``/dev/sdb`` and ``/dev/sdc``::system::chart to avoid the iscsd container from going into crash loops::Execute the cinder-volume-lvm Helm chart::In the `watch terminal` wait for all pods to enter into Running state. If you didn't run watch in a different terminal, you can run it now:: watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces they use a lot. This is by no means a comprehensive guide to Using OpenStack =============== If you were able to successfully reach the end of this guide and `demo1` was successfully deployed, here is a fun list of things you can do with your new cluster. Access Horizon GUI ------------------ 1. Determine Horizon `EXTERNAL IP` Address:: $ kubectl get svc horizon --namespace=kolla NAME CLUSTER-IP EXTERNAL-IP PORT(S) AGE horizon 10.3.3.237 10.240.43.175 80/TCP 1d 2. Determine username and password from keystone:: $ cat ~/keystonerc_admin | grep OS_USERNAME export OS_USERNAME=admin $ cat ~/keystonerc_admin | grep OS_PASSWORD export OS_PASSWORD=Sr6XMFXvbvxQCJ3Cib1xb0gZ3lOtBOD8FCxOcodU 3. Run a browser that has access to your network, and access Horizon GUI with the `EXTERNAL IP` from Step 1, using the credentials from Step 2.

Add required configuration to the end of /etc/kolla/globals.yml::Create a local cloud.yaml file for the deployment of the charts:: setting the variable global.kolla.nova.all.placement_api_enabled to false The next operation is not a simple copy and paste as the rest of this document is structured. To determine this, ``grep network_interface /etc/kolla/globals.yml``. commit_message:
Get rid of custom wrap_db_retry call in sync_allocations

Just for consistency, get rid of the last direct call to
wrap_db_retry and instead use neutron.db.api.retry_db_errors
in the sync_allocations code so we don't potentially get
bitten by slight inconsistencies between the two.

TrivialFix
Related-Bug: #1673243

Change-Id: I975c7d0ec84698d277acbbec6d9cfec5c03439aa
(cherry picked from commit 99e5f4fb4680082407f6c38bad6b7345696e5e9f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/460909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add heat stack actions rbac tests.

Implements RBAC tests for the following policy actions:
  - actions:action

This policy action covers suspend_stack and resume_stack.

However, Tempest's orchestration client does not have
endpoints for cancel stack update and check stack
resources (even though they are valid endpoints),
so tests for either of those endpoints are not included
in this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Avishek Dutta <ad620p@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anthony Bellino <ab2434@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rick Bartra <rb560u@att.com>

Change-Id: Iaab1b2bb960027553379cf4ce4ae5ef1a717635b
Depends-On: If0f716c66c29e0c94e6f64cdb05ee7ba886ec61f

added_lines: # Copyright 2017 AT&T Corporation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.orchestration import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class StackActionsRbacTest(rbac_base.BaseOrchestrationRbacTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(StackActionsRbacTest, cls).resource_setup() image_id = CONF.compute.image_ref flavor = CONF.orchestration.instance_type cls.template_data = cls.read_template('non_empty_stack') cls.parameters = { 'trigger': 'start', 'image': image_id, 'flavor': flavor } cls.template_data = cls.read_template('non_empty_stack') cls.stack_identifier, _ = cls.create_test_stack( template_data=cls.template_data, parameters=cls.parameters) @decorators.idempotent_id('acf8f911-b370-4826-ac1b-9b1ee30c8fe4') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="heat", rule="actions:action") def test_suspend_then_resume_stack(self): """Tests suspend_stack and resume_stack for policy actions:action. Given that these two endpoints enforce the same policy action, they can be tested alongside each other. """ self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.suspend_stack(self.stack_identifier) self.client.resume_stack(self.stack_identifier)

commit_message:
Add heat stack resources patrole tests

Implements RBAC tests for the following policy actions:
 - resource:index
 - resource:show
 - resource:metadata
 - resource:signal
 - resource:mark_unhealthy

Co-Authored-By: Avishek Dutta <ad620p@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samantha Blanco <samantha.blanco@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anthony Bellino <ab2434@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rick Bartra <rb560u@att.com>

Change-Id: If0f716c66c29e0c94e6f64cdb05ee7ba886ec61f
Partially-Implements: blueprint initial-tests-orchestration

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 AT&T Corp # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.orchestration import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class StackResourcesRbacTest(rbac_base.BaseOrchestrationRbacTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(StackResourcesRbacTest, cls).resource_setup() cls.stack_name = data_utils.rand_name('stack') cls.stack_identifier, cls.stack_id = cls._create_stack(cls.stack_name) cls.resource_name = 'fluffy' @classmethod def _create_stack(cls, stack_name=None): if not stack_name: stack_name = data_utils.rand_name('stack') cls.template_data = cls.read_template('non_empty_stack') image_id = CONF.compute.image_ref flavor = CONF.orchestration.instance_type cls.parameters = { 'trigger': 'start', 'image': image_id, 'flavor': flavor } stack_identifier = cls.create_stack( stack_name, template_data=cls.template_data, parameters=cls.parameters) stack_id = stack_identifier.split('/')[1] cls.client.wait_for_stack_status(stack_id, 'CREATE_COMPLETE') return stack_identifier, stack_id @decorators.idempotent_id('1f45ab5c-8ef8-4c97-abac-b1b6964d6bf4') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="heat", rule="resource:index") def test_list_stack_resources(self): self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.list_resources(self.stack_identifier)['resources'] @decorators.idempotent_id('1738a0e3-efff-42ce-98ee-e8ed066a2048') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="heat", rule="resource:show") def test_show_stack_resource(self): self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.show_resource(self.stack_identifier, self.resource_name)[ 'resource'] @decorators.idempotent_id('079b09b9-0723-4c7f-b89f-51e35baf5274') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="heat", rule="resource:metadata") def test_show_stack_resource_metadata(self): self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.show_resource_metadata( self.stack_identifier, self.resource_name)['metadata']

to that policy action underneath swithToRbacRole=True.

Co-Authored-By: Avishek Dutta <ad620p@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anthony Bellino <ab2434@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rick Bartra <rb560u@att.com>

Change-Id: I4ec5ab788fc3cfc03ad5b08af4c2f4507b77ed10
Depends-On: If0f716c66c29e0c94e6f64cdb05ee7ba886ec61f
Partially-Implements: blueprint initial-tests-orchestration
'}]
commit_message:
Add heat events rbac tests.

Implements RBAC tests for the following policy actions:
  - events:list
  - events:show

However, events:list can be covered by the 2 events endpoints
below:
  - list_events
  - list_resource_events

Consequently, this patch adds 2 tests, one test for events:show,
and one test for events:list, with 2 client calls that correspond
to that policy action underneath swithToRbacRole=True.

Co-Authored-By: Avishek Dutta <ad620p@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anthony Bellino <ab2434@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rick Bartra <rb560u@att.com>

Change-Id: I4ec5ab788fc3cfc03ad5b08af4c2f4507b77ed10
Depends-On: If0f716c66c29e0c94e6f64cdb05ee7ba886ec61f
Partially-Implements: blueprint initial-tests-orchestration

commit_message:
Only use handler on filtered services

Since we create a filtered list of services we should use the handler to
only restart those services, rather than all services.

Additionally, we no longer need to check "service_en" since that will
happen when the services are filtered. We can then check if the service
exists before performing the metadata-proxy cleanup.

Change-Id: I4ca3d90123e146d09cab20a0eda627014d9717e6
Depends-On: Ic152cfb01930d8bde10ea6d9aa5bba173a87e376

commit_message:
Add scrapy for openstack-doc-tools testing

The scrapy package is used by openstack-doc-tools for
generating sitemaps.

Package URL: https://scrapy.org/

- Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes. It has active tests, pypi publishing, and works with
  Python 2.x and 3.x.

- Is the library good code?
  I can't really speak to that as it's not my particular forte,
  but it seems robust.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?
  Yes, uses BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?
  Yes.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in global-requirements.txt?
  No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
  Yes. It is used by openstack-doc-tools.

Change-Id: I347527fbbbc314e104bfce218a994c592bc8526f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 23:44:08.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/jenkins-slave/install.d/20-jenkins-slave'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b18e11c0f20deaad34bba84ada1ed288e7a5b190', 'message': "Let the jenkins user own the cache files

Earlier we placed these files in the jenkins user's homedir. That was

doesn't have write access to directories created by root and will fail

commit_message:
Let the jenkins user own the cache files

Earlier we placed these files in the jenkins user's homedir. That was
causing a problem so the cache directory was moved into /opt and
symlinked for backwards compatibility[1]. However, the jenkins user
doesn't have write access to directories created by root and will fail
to write files to that directory in devstack-gate[2][3]. This patch
changes the ownership of the cache directory back to the jenkins user so
that it should work the same as it worked when the directory was in the
jenkins user's homedir.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460835/
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/functions.sh#n516
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/608377

Change-Id: I275f6ac8e5bb71aef904e8b9406a8810dae9bc67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/81/461181/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: chown -R jenkins:jenkins /opt/cache/files

commit_message:
Allow no network to be passed into subnet context

Similar to change I498791614fd456ab67c453cad691f7658d107123,
we can avoid an unnecessary network retrieval by making the network
part of the subnet context lazily loaded by allowing None to be
passed into the subnet context.

If a driver does need items off of the network, the context will
trigger a lookup at the time of reference.

Partial-Bug: #1665967
Change-Id: Ic6651f1d44fcdbb749c99a6cc2c7300b1036388c
(cherry picked from commit 8a1371588d0da485debc2dd8aba4ebad08f3c655)

commit_message:
Pass --concurrent flag to ebtables calls

This flag will force ebtables to acquire a lock so we don't
have to worry about ebtables errors occuring if something else
on the system is trying to use ebtables as well.

Closes-Bug: #1316621
Change-Id: I695c01e015fdc201df8f23d9b48f9d3678240266
(cherry picked from commit 486e2f4eb5a02c98958582e366a4d6081ea897e0)
(cherry picked from commit 470833d36d5313d549c9905d9a36af8cfbcc3330)

commit_message:
Don't configure novncproxy_base_url on controller

This parameter is only consumed by nova-compute.
In packstack this causes problem, when compute and
controller are located on the same node and this
parameter is set to: http://0.0.0.0:6080/vnc_auto.html
Thus this compute node returns incorrect novnc url.

Change-Id: I03c6329d805081cfc29aa640bbacbdba2c899422
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
XtremIO: allow a cloned volume with larger size

* In case the new volume is larger than the cloned one,
    resize the cloned volume.
* Added unit test for success and failed resize.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I2346049c2177a9497750c05c0eb9e7edf8c12c22
Closes-Bug: #1554778
(cherry picked from commit 105e625328a3ead1fb9b788e54e81a9b5d9af5ab)

commit_message:
Use correct retry mechanism in tags

This replaces wrap_db_retry with
neutron.db.api.retry_if_session_inactive() in the tags
plugin.

wrap_db_retry is missing a bunch of exception types we
can encounter and are expected to retry in normal database
operations in Neutron (e.g. staledataerror in the bug report).

This patch doesn't include a unit test because there is already
quite a bit of coverage ensuring the decorator handles these types
of exceptions.

Closes-Bug: #1673243
Change-Id: I65b10ee54301401cd4525152a82a604ac8744582
(cherry picked from commit 44b6fcb4d26eaa5e28f147d903482f8fdd37d911)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/08/460908/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @db_api.retry_if_session_inactive()
deleted_lines: from oslo_db import api as oslo_db_api from oslo_db import exception as db_exc @oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry( max_retries=db_api.MAX_RETRIES, exception_checker=lambda e: isinstance(e, db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry))

commit_message:
Dont try to apply iptables rules in a endless loop

If the namespace does not exist the current behavior
is to try to apply the iptables rules forever in a
endless loop. This fills up the logs on the network
node and leads to outage.

Change-Id: I628b18a66f9478d7349fa1817431aae2f62ee105
Related-bug: #1623664
Related-bug: #1573073
(cherry picked from commit 3889b0f214fbb1d32531395cff232cf57daf7b17)

commit_message:
Fix cinder volume leakage

A cinder volume remains after
the 'test_boot_server_with_legacy_bdm_volume_id_only'
functional test.
It is resource leakage. So fix it.

Change-Id: I3cacbac6468b5fad1c9666892fc57906af24b169
Partial-Bug: #1613105
(cherry-picked from commit 4d956d06f8c2bd3971cd46fb7ccdab33aaa5709c)

commit_message:
Pass --concurrent flag to ebtables calls

This flag will force ebtables to acquire a lock so we don't
have to worry about ebtables errors occuring if something else
on the system is trying to use ebtables as well.

Closes-Bug: #1316621
Change-Id: I695c01e015fdc201df8f23d9b48f9d3678240266
(cherry picked from commit 486e2f4eb5a02c98958582e366a4d6081ea897e0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/16/460916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return execute(['ebtables', '--concurrent'] + comm, run_as_root=True)

is a GET call, we can end up with an uninitialized policy

This just calls policy.init() in the after hook as well.

Change-Id: I29ebc9a91b98a27e707d5b35ad1a24a26e8c8f44

(cherry picked from commit 4c40016dfba21a851d1cac5ce199ddcca001562b)

commit_message:
Init policy in pecan after hook as well

policy.init() is called in the before hook, but this isn't
invoked on GET calls so if the first call a thread receives
is a GET call, we can end up with an uninitialized policy
enforcer and get a traceback.

This just calls policy.init() in the after hook as well.

Change-Id: I29ebc9a91b98a27e707d5b35ad1a24a26e8c8f44
Closes-Bug: #1671267
(cherry picked from commit 4c40016dfba21a851d1cac5ce199ddcca001562b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/13/460913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: policy.init()

commit_message:
Simplify RootHelperProcess._read_stream()

select() itself has timeout mechanism, so we do not need to use
wait_until_true wrapper.

Related-Bug: #1674557
Change-Id: I35bc4716f0d1e0d92e7b7a3f6dcb6978e9d725f9
(cherry picked from commit a7898c54954396f8fdfe86a6445f5e5648407d5e)

added_lines: rready, _wready, _xready = select.select([stream], [], [], timeout) if not rready: raise RuntimeError('No output in %.2f seconds' % timeout)
deleted_lines: import functools poll_predicate = functools.partial( select.select, [stream], [], [], 1) common_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: poll_predicate()[0], timeout, 0.1, RuntimeError('No output in %.2f seconds' % timeout))

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-24 12:00:03.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/173213a33084a86474f8fdd1f4d4d2114fb9b4ac', 'message': "Redirect stack-show output in tripleo.sh

We use these functions in CI, and it bloats the console.log because
we dump the entire stack twice, and it's already stored in the postci
log.  We only care if the stack-show returns zero (e.g the stack exists)
so redirect any output.

Change-Id: I70f9b47606d3b3cf7683bcde379c0609ff48a72d
"}]
commit_message:
Redirect stack-show output in tripleo.sh

We use these functions in CI, and it bloats the console.log because
we dump the entire stack twice, and it's already stored in the postci
log.  We only care if the stack-show returns zero (e.g the stack exists)
so redirect any output.

Change-Id: I70f9b47606d3b3cf7683bcde379c0609ff48a72d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/57/459257/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if heat stack-show "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" 2>&1 > /dev/null ; then if heat stack-show "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
deleted_lines: if heat stack-show "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" ; then if heat stack-show "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" ; then

commit_message:
Fixes Octavia not working with Barbican

Adds conversion of the Barbicna payload (see changes at
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-barbicanclient/usage.html)
by using oslo's encodeutils

Change-Id: Ibc9fdc8b1bb19b07e70581c6aaa25c5e45bdb1ba
Closes-Bug: #1681595

added_lines: return self._convert(self._cert_container.certificate.payload) intermediates = self._convert( self._cert_container.intermediates.payload) return self._convert(self._cert_container.private_key.payload) return self._convert( self._cert_container.private_key_passphrase.payload) # BBQ will return twodifferent types for payload def _convert(self, data): if isinstance(data, six.text_type): data = data.encode('utf-8') return six.b(data)
deleted_lines: return self._cert_container.certificate.payload intermediates = self._cert_container.intermediates.payload return self._cert_container.private_key.payload return self._cert_container.private_key_passphrase.payload

Also, removing the logging of the passed value of an HTTP
header.  If the value could not be encoded to log, then there
are Tracebacks that showed up with Python 3.5.  Since the value
can be passed by a user, it should either be scrubbed before logging

stream.

commit_message:
Fixes for Running Functional Tests with Python 3.5

Fixing the standard things when making code py27/p35 compatible.

Also, removing the logging of the passed value of an HTTP
header.  If the value could not be encoded to log, then there
are Tracebacks that showed up with Python 3.5.  Since the value
can be passed by a user, it should either be scrubbed before logging
or not logged, to prevent possible content injection in the log
stream.

Change-Id: I8df1553acb6c7e5f75a1b50f024dc032ca982a93
